title: Benedict Cumberbatch is one brave stuntman as he throws himself off London bus
text:
Benedict Cumberbatch is one brave stuntman (Picture: SplashNews)

Benedict Cumberbatch sure takes his acting duties seriously, as he was pictured throwing himself off a London bus while performing a stunt.

The 43-year-old is currently living the life of actor Louis Wain for his upcoming biopic and had one heck of a brave moment on set.

After stepping onto the big red bus, the Sherlock star was then spotted hurling himself to the ground in a dramatic scene.

As he collapsed to the floor, the father-of-two stuck up his hands and ended up looking like a tortoise that had flipped onto its back.

Seriously, it’s a mood.

He threw himself off a London bus (Picture: Splash News)

The star collapsed to the floor (Picture: Splash News)

Benedict looked worlds apart from his usual perky self and had been aged for the role with a grey wig and mustache.

He was dressed in a grey suit jacket, that was paired with brown suede shoes and matching trousers.

The film, which is set in the 19th century, follows the life of the painter, and his partner Emily.

Claire Foy will star alongside the popular actor as his on-screen girlfriend.

He did not look his best self (Picture: Splash News)

The star is current filming the Louis Wain biopic (Picture: Splash News)

Just recently, Benedict admitted he feels like he let his parents down after they ‘scrimped and saved’ as jobbing actors to send him to the £13,925 a term boarding school, the Harrow School.

Speaking about his parents Wanda Ventham and dad Timothy Carlton, he told The Lady magazine: ‘They scrimped and saved to get their only son the very best education possible.

‘And I took that education threw it all in their face and became an actor anyway.’

Benedict added: ‘To this day, one of the reasons I get out of bed in the morning is to make them proud of me.’

The actor was Oscar nominated for his role in The Imitation Game and has received praise for his parts in 12 Years A Slave and The Fifth Estate.

And at this year’s San Diego Comic-Con, it was announced Benedict will be returning in Phase Four as Doctor Strange for his second solo film, Doctor Strange In The Multiverse of Madness.
